section.title: Introduction
section.simpara: backbone.js brings MVC style of development to JavaScript. The source code of backbone.js has todos application which can be seen in action here .

The source code of todos is ,although, simple might seem intimidating to some. This ebook is my attempt to build the application in 18 incremental steps. First step will have not have any JavaScript code and slowly JavaScript code will be added.
backbone.js is undergoing a lot of change very rapidly. As of this writing backbone.js 0.5.2 was the most stable release and that’s what is used in this application.

section.title: Error
section.programlisting: Uncaught Error: A "url" property of function must be specified
section.simpara: We are getting that error because when model is saved then backbone invokes Backbone.Sync which attempts to save the record on the server. Since we have not specified how the model should be saved we are getting the error.

section.title: step 6 : add backbone-localstorage
section.simpara: In this step backbone-localstorage has been added. backbone-localstorage is a simple module to replace Backbone.sync with localStorage-based persistence. Models are given GUIDS, and saved into a JSON object.

section.title: Explanation
section.simpara: When Todos.create is invoked then todo item is stored in localstorage.

After entering a todo item when you hit enter then todo item is stored but you don’t see the newly added item. That is because we need to build the view to display the stored data. That’s what we are going to do in upcoming steps.

section.simpara: When a user clicks delete image to delete a todo item then function clear is invoked. This function destroys the model. When a model is destroyed then model invokes a callbacks bound to name destroy. In the initialize method an event binding is done such that when a model is destroyed then remove method is invoked.
In the remove method this.el is used to delete the view fragment. Note that in view this.el refers to the view fragement.
